Articles.Content: Okay I've been gone sense NASA pack and have only just come back to KSP other then them changing mods to curse has anything major happened? Also I here KSP has now gone to 64bit. Is this true or just rumor? If its true how do I get the 64bit version? I use steam to run KSP so I'm not sure if it just gives me the 64 edition or if I have to find it elsewhere?

Yup KSP is 64bit. But its optional. You go into the KSP files and it says KSP_64x. Run that and your KSP is running 64bit. You can run more mods but 64bit is buggy, and some mods aren't compatible with 64bit. Use at your own risk.

Yeah, if you've got Steam, that will keep running 32-bit by default. I don't recommend changing that, but to create a desktop shortcut to the 64-bit EXE for when you're feeling that way.

The other major thing is that there's now money so career mode has to take that into account.

Umm... it's the second time I see a KSP_64x (or KSP_x64 last time) mentioned on the forums, yet that is not on my computer. I guess I should re-download a KSP installer from Squad's website.

The other major thing is that there's now money so career mode has to take that into account.

Yes but you can pick "Science" as a type of game if you want the science without the money aspect... which is very nice of Squad to do !

Umm... it's the second time I see a KSP_64x (or KSP_x64 last time) mentioned on the forums, yet that is not on my computer. I guess I should re-download a KSP installer from Squad's website.

If you have Steam, you get both EXEs in the same folder. I think the same is true for the Squad version, too, but I'm not sure.

You missed quite a bit, Dimetime. Get a load of the latest by looking at some of the articles and daiy kerbal section posts. There's tons of info there about the last update, the next update and beyond.

If you have Steam, you get both EXEs in the same folder. I think the same is true for the Squad version, too, but I'm not sure.

Win64 is a separate download through the KSP store.

On Steam, both x32 and x64 versions are provided automatically. Otherwise, the x64 version is a completely separate download, and does not (yet) work with the patcher, so you also have to download updates manually.
